Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to indicate a preference
Elaboration: Repeating actions to obtain a preferred response; for example, pressing repeatedly on a voice-output device

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to indicate a preference
Elaboration: Using gestures, facial expressions, movements, signed language, spoken language, voice-output devices and/or images to communicate preferences

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to indicate a preference
Elaboration: Imitating a sound associated with an action or object, for example animal or everyday sounds

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to indicate a preference
Elaboration: Making a request for a motivating item by exchanging a symbol

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to indicate a preference
Elaboration: Pointing to their drink bottle and saying, ‘More.’, or shaking their head and pointing to a symbol of food

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Participating in shared reading opportunities and exploring key features of a book

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Reaching for a book or patting the pages when it is being read

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Opening and closing a book

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Looking at or pointing to pictures

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Turning multiple pages at a time during a shared reading experience

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Turn pages and identify the appropriate orientation of print and digital texts
Elaboration: Activating a switch or swiping on a screen to go to the next page in a digital text

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to describe an object with a single gesture, symbol or word
Elaboration: Choosing from a prepared selection of images of attributes to describe an object; for example, choosing ‘big’ to describe a car

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to describe an object with a single gesture, symbol or word
Elaboration: Using gestures, facial expressions, movements, signed language, spoken language, voice-output devices and/or images to describe an object; for example, communicating ‘hot’ or ‘cold’ when presented with an iceblock or heat pack

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Identify a favourite image in print or digital text
Elaboration: Matching an image on a page with a representation of that image (object or symbol) from a small collection in response to a question about a story, for example an image of a dog in a story where the main character is a dog

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Identify a favourite image in print or digital text
Elaboration: Selecting an object, image or symbol in response to a question or direction related to a text; for example, choosing a character from a collection of images

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Recognise and name familiar objects, actions and activities
Elaboration: Recognising the sounds and prompts for routines, for example images and/or symbols that indicate group learning, and bells or music to signal mealtimes

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Recognise and name familiar objects, actions and activities
Elaboration: Recognising or responding when familiar objects are named, for example their own schoolbag, clothing, lunch box and/or drink bottle

Subject: English
Substrand: Language for expressing and developing ideas
ContentDescription: Recognise and name familiar objects, actions and activities
Elaboration: Identifying a picture or illustration in a book when named, for example by pointing or using eye gaze

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify an event in literary texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Listening to and/or viewing stories by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander storytellers from print, visual, digital and multimodal sources

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify an event in literary texts by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and illustrators and a range of Australian and world authors and illustrators
Elaboration: Responding to an event in a story, for example when a dog chases a ball in a park

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Respond to an event in a story
Elaboration: Looking to locate the source of sounds associated with a text; for example, responding to animal noises produced by the reader or generated from a sound-output device when being read a text about animals

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Respond to an event in a story
Elaboration: Recognising words and/or images for common objects, such as ‘book’

Subject: English
Substrand: Engaging with and responding to literature
ContentDescription: Respond to an event in a story
Elaboration: Participating in stories that have a repetitive and/or anticipatory event

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify an event in a familiar text
Elaboration: Selecting an image or sound that represents an event described in a story

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify an event in a familiar text
Elaboration: Choosing the correct image from a selection of 2 to represent an event in text

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify an event in a familiar text
Elaboration: Matching an image or word that represents an event in a text; for example, choosing an image of a cake to represent a celebration in a book

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to chants, rhymes and songs
Elaboration: Demonstrating awareness of or interest in familiar chants, rhymes and songs

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to chants, rhymes and songs
Elaboration: Participating in activities that use music to explore and support familiarisation of chants, rhymes and songs

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to chants, rhymes and songs
Elaboration: Using body language to respond to repeated sounds, chants and rhymes

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to chants, rhymes and songs
Elaboration: Vocalising or using objects around them to accompany chants, rhymes or songs; for example, shaking a maraca

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Respond to chants, rhymes and songs
Elaboration: Using their preferred communication modality or actions to participate in songs

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to attend and respond to interactions with others
Elaboration: Communicating consistent preferences; for example, reaching towards a favourite person or object, or choosing a symbol that represents a preference

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to attend and respond to interactions with others
Elaboration: Seeking attention through vocalisation, eye contact, gesture or action

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality to attend and respond to interactions with others
Elaboration: Greeting known people, for example by smiling or waving

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Repeat some familiar letter sounds
Elaboration: Participating in known chants, rhymes and songs to hear and notice sounds

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Repeat some familiar letter sounds
Elaboration: Participating in shared reading by contributing sounds in anticipation of familiar text

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Repeat some familiar letter sounds
Elaboration: Repeating letter sounds using their preferred communication modality

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Repeat some familiar letter sounds
Elaboration: Participating in letter and sound activities, for example letter hunts in sensory boxes

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify some familiar images, symbols, letters or words in their environment
Elaboration: Responding to a presented symbol or word; for example, moving towards their chair when shown a symbol of a chair, or ceasing an activity when shown an image or symbol that represents ‘finished’

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify some familiar images, symbols, letters or words in their environment
Elaboration: Connecting sounds with symbols or pictures; for example, making relevant sounds in response to a picture

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify some familiar images, symbols, letters or words in their environment
Elaboration: Choosing a symbol to identify a preferred item; for example, pointing to, reaching for or selecting the ‘fruit’ symbol to indicate their preferences for morning tea, or choosing an object that represents their favourite song

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify some familiar images, symbols, letters or words in their environment
Elaboration: Identifying their image and/or name on their photo name card, for example when marking attendance

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify themselves in a mirror
Elaboration: Engaging with their image in a mirror

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify themselves in a mirror
Elaboration: Responding to the question, ‘Where is [name]?’ and identifying themselves in a mirror by looking towards or touching it, pointing to self

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Identify themselves in a mirror
Elaboration: Identifying that something is different in their mirrored reflection, for example the addition of a hat or other headwear

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality when listening to and/or viewing texts
Elaboration: Reaching towards a book, or a prop associated with a book being read

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality when listening to and/or viewing texts
Elaboration: Clapping or vocalising at a favourite part of a book

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality when listening to and/or viewing texts
Elaboration: Copying actions from known stories

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use their preferred communication modality when listening to and/or viewing texts
Elaboration: Participating by contributing a word or sound in a repetitive text

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Co-create short texts that record a single idea
Elaboration: Making marks or selecting letters with writing intention, for example when naming a piece of schoolwork

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Co-create short texts that record a single idea
Elaboration: Responding when asked to write; for example, selecting letters or making marks with increased attention, interest and engagement

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Co-create short texts that record a single idea
Elaboration: Producing nonlinear shapes, for example spirals or vaguely horizontal and vertical lines

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use tools to create a variety of marks on a surface
Elaboration: Imitating simple marks and nonlinear shapes, for example spirals when co-constructing a text with an adult

Subject: English
ContentDescription: Use tools to create a variety of marks on a surface
Elaboration: Using a keyboard, touch screen other writing tool to select letters or symbols when asked to write
